name: AS12200 Rackspace Global Backbone
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RADB as-name RACKSPACE. Global backbone consolidating US and Europe. 4 IPv4 prefixes, 11,776 addresses. 1000 IPv4 prefixes advertised via PeeringDB, 100 IPv6 prefixes. Traffic 100-200 Gbps heavy outbound. Upstream transit from GTT (AS3257), Level3/Lumen (AS3356), Zayo (AS6461), Akamai (AS32787). Provides transit to AS14492, AS15395, AS16805, AS19994, AS22205, AS22576, AS24778, AS27357, AS33070, AS36248, AS39921, AS54535. IRR set AS-RACKSPACE, mnt-by MAINT-AS10532. Peering policy open. Last RADB modification 2023-11-13. Source: peeringdb.com/net/22, bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS12200, bgp.he.net/AS12200. DNS confirms rackspacecloud.com A: 50.56.157.238 and clouddrive.com A: 172.99.75.178 on backbone. Source: DNS A records rackspacecloud.com, clouddrive.com. RADB AS-RACKSPACE as-set (authoritative, MAINT-AS10532) confirms 13 direct ASN members + 5 sub-sets + AS200069. 17 Internet Exchanges, 145 announced prefixes (139 IPv4, 6 IPv6), 191 BGP peers observed, 5,888 originated IPv4 addresses. Source update: bgp.he.net/AS12200, bgp.he.net/irr/as-set/AS-RACKSPACE (2026-02-24 verification). AS12200 transit topology: receives from AS3257 (GTT), AS3356 (Lumen/Level3), AS6461 (Zayo), AS32787 (Akamai). Provides transit to AS14492, AS15395, AS16805, AS19994, AS22205, AS22576, AS24778, AS27357, AS33070, AS36248, AS39921, AS54535 (Nike customer). Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS12200 (data snapshot 2021-01-10).

name: AS33070 Rackspace DFW (Dallas-Fort Worth)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RADB as-name RACKSPACE-DFW, descr 'Rackspace - Dallas, TX'. ARIN OrgId RACKS-8, registered 2004-09-24, last updated 2012-02-24. 212 IPv4 prefixes, 799,723 addresses, rank #418. 96 announced BGP routes. 1 IPv6 prefix 2001:4800::/32. 381,358 hosted domains, 7,128 nameservers including dns2.stabletransit.com and ns2.rackspace.com. Receives transit from AS12200. Sample prefixes: 23.253.64.0/18, 23.253.224.0/19, 50.56.128.0/20, 50.56.144.0/22, 50.56.152.0/21. 2 bogon prefixes detected. Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS33070, dnslytics.com/bgp/as33070, bgp.he.net/AS33070. 96 IPv4 prefixes announced, 1 IPv6 prefix (2001:4800::/32). 381,358+ hosted domains, 7,128+ nameservers. Example prefixes: 23.253.64.0/18, 23.253.224.0/19. Source: dnslytics.com/bgp/as33070, ipinfo.io/AS33070 (154,264 domains, 16,257 IPs).

name: AS27357 Rackspace IAD (Ashburn/Herndon VA)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RADB as-name RACKSPACE, descr 'Rackspace Hosting'. ARIN registered 2003-02-20, last updated 2012-02-24. 99 IPv4 prefixes, 258,306 addresses, rank #925. 1 IPv6 prefix. Receives transit from AS12200. Provides transit to Mailgun Technologies (AS396479). Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS27357, bgp.he.net/AS27357. Updated stats: 259,840 originated IPv4 addresses, 84,162 hosted domains. Source update: bgp.he.net/AS27357, ipinfo.io/AS27357 (2026-02-24). Key prefixes: 69.20.0.0/17, 23.253.128.0/19, 104.130.0.0/18, 146.20.0.0/16, 173.203.128.0/18, 74.205.0.0/19, 172.99.64.0/19. IPv6: 2001:4802::/32, 2620:103:2::/48. 114,311+ domains, 2,005+ nameservers (incl dns1.stabletransit.com, ns.rackspace.com). Upstream: AS12200 only. Downstream: AS396479 (Mailgun). Source: networksdb.io/autonomous-system/AS27357, dnslytics.com/bgp/as27357.

name: AS19994 Rackspace ORD (Chicago)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RADB as-name RACKSPACE-ORD, descr 'Rackspace - Chicago, IL'. Provides transit to Mailgun Technologies (AS396479). Sample prefix: 104.130.112.0/21. Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS19994, bgp.he.net/AS19994. Updated stats: 537,344 originated IPv4 addresses, 85,429 hosted domains. Source update: bgp.he.net/AS19994, ipinfo.io/AS19994 (2026-02-24). Largest Rackspace ASN by address count (539,536 IPv4). 1 IPv6 prefix. Upstream: AS12200 only. Downstream: AS396479 (Mailgun). #571 out of 75,623 ASNs by IPv4 space. Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS19994.

name: AS15395 Rackspace LON (United Kingdom)

Key prefixes: 5.79.0.0/18, 31.222.128.0/18. 1 IPv6 prefix: 2a00:1a48::/32. 108,583+ hosted domains, 1,006+ nameservers (incl dns2.stabletransit.com, ns2.rackspace.com). RIPE org: ORG-RA33-RIPE (Rackspace Ltd). AS15395 RIPE status: ASSIGNED. Source: dnslytics.com/bgp/as15395.

name: AS39921 Rackspace UK Secondary

name: AS10532 Rackspace San Antonio Origin
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Original Rackspace ASN. ARIN OrgId RACKS-8, 1718 Dry Creek Way Ste 115, San Antonio TX 78259. RADB maintainer MAINT-AS10532 manages all Rackspace ASN IRR records. Abuse contact abuse@rackspace.com, tech contact ipadmin@rackspace.com, phone +1-210-312-4000. Source: bgp.he.net/AS10532, bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS33070 (ARIN WHOIS block). CONFIRMED: Zero BGP prefixes currently originated. Functions as administrative/origin ASN for Rackspace Hosting (RACKS-8). ARIN registered 2002-07-12, 1 Fanatical Place, Windcrest TX 78218. OrgNOC: Chris Hansell (HANSE157-ARIN). This ASN anchors the AS-RACKSPACE RADB as-set but does not originate routing prefixes. Source: bgp.tools/as/10532 (0 IPv4, 0 IPv6), bgpview.io/asn/10532.

name: AS58683 Rackspace SYD/APAC (Sydney/Singapore)

APNIC org ORG-RHKL1-AP (Rackspace.com Hong Kong Limited). as-name RACKSPACE-AS, country AU. 3 IPv4 prefixes, 2 IPv6 prefixes originated. 128 /24 equivalents (~32,768 IPs). 5,261 hosted domains across 619 IPs. Upstream: AS12200 only. Abuse: abuse@rackspace.com (ABUSE RACKSPACEAU). Registered 2012-08-24. #31 unique domains, #64 originated IPv4 space in Australia. Source: bgp.tools/as/58683, ipinfo.io/AS58683, bgpview.io/asn/58683.

name: AS14492 DataPipe Inc (Acquired)

PeeringDB: AS14492 US-East (primary DataPipe ASN). IRR as-set AS-DATAPIPE. Traffic 1-5Gbps, balanced ratio, global scope. Suggested max prefixes: 75 IPv4, 10 IPv6. Receives transit from AS12200 backbone. DataPipe acquired by Rackspace November 2017. Rackspace updated abuse/tech contacts to @rackspace.com. PeeringDB last updated 2022-07-27. Source: peeringdb.com/net/230.
cidr: Various (75 IPv4 prefixes, 4 IPv6 prefixes per PeeringDB)

name: AS396479 Mailgun Technologies Inc
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Mailgun Technologies Inc, Rackspace subsidiary. Receives transit from AS19994 (ORD) and AS27357 (IAD). Email API platform network. Source: bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS19994 (transit-to), bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS27357 (transit-to). NOTE: Mailgun spun off from Rackspace in 2017, acquired by Thoma Bravo 2019, then by Sinch AB 2021 for $1.9B. ASN still receives transit from AS27357 (IAD) and AS19994 (ORD) within Rackspace backbone. Zone should be 'external' — ownership has changed but routing relationship persists. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mailgun, sinch.com/news. MAILGUN-US (MT-757). ARIN registered 2017-06-21. 106 IPv4 prefixes originated, 27,136 IPs, 0 IPv6. 3 BGP peers, 3 upstreams (incl AS27357 IAD, AS19994 ORD via Rackspace backbone). 119 hosted domains. Address: 112 E Pecan St #1135, San Antonio TX 78205. Abuse: abuse@mailgun.org. OrgTech: noc@mailgun.com, ops@mailgun.com. MAILJET OPS contact (ops@mailjet.com) also registered under this ASN — confirms Mailgun/Mailjet operational merger. Traceroute path shows AS27357→AS396479 transit via Rackspace IAD (69.20.x, 146.20.x). Source: bgp.he.net/AS396479, bgp.tools/as/396479, ipinfo.io/AS396479.

name: Rackspace Authoritative DNS (Anycast)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Authoritative nameservers ns.rackspace.com (69.20.95.4) and ns2.rackspace.com (65.61.188.4). Globally distributed Anycast network with DNS servers in Texas, Virginia, Chicago, and London. If a DC fails, queries auto-failover to next closest location. Monitored 24/7. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-dns-faq, docs.rackspace.com/docs/nslookup-checking-dns-records-on-windows.

name: Rackspace Cloud DNS (stabletransit.com)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Cloud Server default nameservers dns1.stabletransit.com and dns2.stabletransit.com. Resolvers for Cloud Servers infrastructure. Cloud DNS API endpoint dns.api.rackspacecloud.com. Default TTL 3600 seconds. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/create-dns-records-for-cloud-servers-with-the-control-panel, docs.rackspace.com/docs/migrate-your-dns-records. DNS authoritative infrastructure serving *.stabletransit.com zones. dns1.stabletransit.com hosted on AS27357 (IAD), dns2.stabletransit.com on AS15395 (LON). No dedicated CIDR — DNS service distributed across Rackspace production ASNs.
cidr: Service (distributed via AS33070 DFW, AS27357 IAD, AS19994 ORD, AS15395 LON)

name: Rackspace Cloud Office DNS (name-services.com)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Cloud Office hosted email DNS via dns1-5.name-services.com. Supports MX, SPF (v=spf1 include:emailsrvr.com ~all), DKIM, DMARC, Autodiscover (autodiscover.emailsrvr.com CNAME). SPF include mechanism delegates to emailsrvr.com IP space. SPF does NOT pass alignment; DKIM required for DMARC compliance. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/find-dns-host, docs.rackspace.com/docs/set-up-dns-records-for-cloud-office-email, mxtoolbox.com/c/outboundemailsources?public=RackSpace, support.powerdmarc.com. DNS authoritative infrastructure for name-services.com zones supporting Rackspace Email/Cloud Office. No dedicated CIDR — DNS service distributed across production network.

name: Rackspace London Caching DNS
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Internal caching nameserver cachens1.lon.rackspace.com at 83.138.151.80. Observed in nslookup debug traces for UK-origin queries. Provides recursive resolution for London-based infrastructure. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/nslookup-checking-dns-records-on-windows.

name: RackConnect Global MPLS VPN Backbone
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Software-defined multi-cloud interconnection platform. MPLS VPN over proprietary Rackspace backbone. All traffic avoids public internet. Speeds: 50 Mbps, 100 Mbps, 200 Mbps, 500 Mbps, 1 Gbps, 2 Gbps, 5 Gbps, 10 Gbps. Fixed monthly pricing, no bandwidth-variable charges. Private fiber blending tariffs from multiple telecom carriers. Connects via Equinix Cloud Exchange Fabric, Megaport, and Unitas Global. Edge devices provisioned via LOA through colocation portal. Equinix only supported colocation provider for dedicated cross-connects. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackconnect-global-faq, docs.rackspace.com/docs/rackconnect-global-user-workflow, rackspace.com/cloud/rackconnect-global.

name: RackConnect Megaport APAC Exchange Fabric
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] RackConnect Global interconnection via Megaport in APAC. All APAC connections are Megaport-only (no Equinix). PoPs: Adelaide, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, Perth, Sydney (AU); Auckland, Hamilton, Wellington (NZ). 9 cities total. Source: datacenterlocations.com/rackspace.

name: RackConnect Megaport Europe Exchange Fabric
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] RackConnect Global interconnection via Megaport in Europe. PoPs: Sofia (BG), London (GB), Dublin (IE), Berlin, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Munich, Nuremberg (DE), Amsterdam (NL), Stockholm (SE). 11 cities total. Source: datacenterlocations.com/rackspace.

name: RackConnect Megaport North America Exchange Fabric
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] RackConnect Global interconnection via Megaport in North America. PoPs: Toronto ON, Montreal QC, Quebec City QC (CA); Ashburn VA, New York NY, Newark NJ, Chicago IL, Dallas TX, Houston TX, Seattle WA, Portland OR, Silicon Valley CA, Los Angeles CA, Las Vegas NV (US). 14 cities total. name: RackConnect Equinix Europe Exchange Fabric
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] RackConnect Global interconnection via Equinix Cloud Exchange in Europe. Single connection point at Equinix LD5, London Slough, England. Source: datacenterlocations.com/rackspace.

name: RackConnect Equinix North America Exchange Fabric
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] RackConnect Global interconnection via Equinix Cloud Exchange in North America. Facility connections: DC1-DC8, DC10, DC11 (Ashburn VA, 10 facilities); CH1-CH4 (Chicago IL, 4 facilities); DA1-DA4, DA6 (Dallas TX, 5 facilities). 19 Equinix facility cross-connect points total. name: AWS Website Hosting (us-east-1)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] AWS-hosted corporate website infrastructure. rackspace.com, rackspace.co.uk, and datapipe.com all resolve to identical AWS IPs: 3.227.192.229 and 52.1.14.221 (us-east-1 region). Confirms corporate website hosted off Rackspace infrastructure. datapipe.com consolidation confirmed by shared A records. rackspace.com registered 1998-08-14, is only domain with server-side registry locks (serverDeleteProhibited, serverTransferProhibited, serverUpdateProhibited). Source: DNS A records rackspace.com/rackspace.co.uk/datapipe.com, WHOIS rackspace.com. Rackspace corporate website (rackspace.com, rackspacetechnology.com) hosted on AWS infrastructure in us-east-1. CIDRs are Amazon-owned and dynamically assigned. No Rackspace-registered IP space involved.

name: Rackspace Corporate Email Sending Network (spf_a)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Rackspace corporate email sending IPs authorized by spf_a.rackspace.com. Includes Rackspace IPs (192.237.130.252/30, 23.253.136.4/30, 192.237.132.24/31, 104.130.178.8/31, 198.61.241.222, 204.232.164.222, 173.203.4.141/32, 173.203.4.142/32, 72.4.116.13/32, 72.4.116.14/32, 72.3.252.143/32, 72.3.252.136/32), UK IPs (89.234.41.56/31, 212.100.224.17/32, 212.100.224.18/32, 92.52.112.192/31), APAC IPs (119.9.4.1/32, 120.136.34.40/31, 119.9.2.96/31, 13.236.96.33), and AWS IPs (107.23.16.222, 54.173.83.138, 107.20.210.250, 52.1.14.157, 54.200.217.100, 52.210.16.151, 23.22.241.76). rDNS confirms 212.100.224.17 = smtp1-ext.lon3.corp.rackspace.com, 212.100.224.18 = smtp2-ext.lon3.corp.rackspace.com. spf_b.rackspace.com DNS query failed (connection refused). Source: SPF chain rackspace.com -> spf_a.rackspace.com, rDNS 212.100.224.0/24. Email sending infrastructure authorized via SPF TXT records on rackspace.com. IPs fall within existing Rackspace ASN ranges rather than dedicated allocation.
cidr: Service (SPF-authorized sending IPs within Rackspace ASNs)

name: DFW Corporate Infrastructure (72.3.128.0/24)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] DFW1 corporate infrastructure network. 127 Rackspace hosts identified via rDNS. Edge routers: vlan901-905.edge1-4.dfw1.rackspace.com, edge3-distro.dfw1.rackspace.net. Core: core1-4.dfw1.rackspace.net, fcp.dfw1.rackspace.net. DDoS: arbor-dfw.dfw3.rackspace.net, arbor-dfw-netflow.dfw1.rackspace.net, cisco-guard2-3.dfw1.rackspace.net, guard1-4 with proxy and g-interface sub-entries. Bastion: secure-bastion.dfw1.rackspace.com (72.3.128.84), bastion1-2.dfw1.rackspace.com. DNS: cachens1-2.dfw1.rackspace.com, dnscore1-6.dfw1.rackspace.com. Mail: mail.rackspace.com (72.3.128.170). AV: etrustserver.rackspace.com (72.3.128.165). Source: rDNS 72.3.128.0/24.

name: IAD Corporate Infrastructure (69.20.0.0/24)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] IAD1/IAD2 corporate infrastructure network. 55 Rackspace hosts identified via rDNS. Bastion: secure-bastion.iad2 (69.20.0.1), bast1-2.iad1. Routing: aggr1-2 on VLAN 120-125.iad1. VPN: vpn1-2.iad1 (69.20.0.36-37), newvpn.iad1 (69.20.0.41). Firewalls: fw1.iad1, fwcs.iad1. NAT/HSRP: hsrp.vlan121-125.iad1, nat-vlan100/104.iad1. DNS: cachens1-2.iad1, cachens1.iad3. Monitoring: rackwatch.iad1 (69.20.0.166), col-1/2.rackwatch.iad1. Syslog: syslog-1.iad1 (69.20.0.173). Security: seconly.rackspace.com (69.20.0.180), seconly-new (69.20.0.185). BMC: bmc.iad1 (69.20.0.174). Provisioning: rhnproxy1-2.iad1. Source: rDNS 69.20.0.0/24.

name: LON Corporate Infrastructure (212.100.224.0/24)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] LON data center corporate infrastructure network. 32 Rackspace hosts identified via rDNS. Routing: aggr1a.lon.rackspace.net (212.100.224.2). Bastion: bastion1.lon (212.100.224.13). VPN: vpn.lon (212.100.224.9). TACACS: tacacs1.lon (212.100.224.12). DNS: cachens1.lon (212.100.224.10), cachens1-1/2.lon (212.100.224.29-30). Mail: mx.lon (212.100.224.14), smtp1-ext.lon3.corp (212.100.224.17), smtp2-ext.lon3.corp (212.100.224.18). Monitoring: mrtg.lon (212.100.224.11), wug.lon (212.100.224.27). Switch: switch1.lon (212.100.224.15). Provisioning: rhnproxy1-2.lon (212.100.224.6-7, .19), mirror.rackspace.co.uk (212.100.224.8). Traffic: trafficaccounting.lon.corp (212.100.224.16). Source: rDNS 212.100.224.0/24.

name: SAT/HQ Corporate Network (64.39.0.0/24)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] San Antonio headquarters corporate network. 80 Rackspace hosts identified via rDNS. HQ gateway: hsrp7.hq (64.39.0.1). Routing: vlan7.aggr1-2.sat. SAT4: aggrit1-2.vlan0132.sat4, hsrp-vlan0132.sat4 (64.39.0.33). SAT6: aggrit51a-b.sat6, hsrp132-133.sat6. AUS1: aggrit3-4.vlan132.aus1, hsrp132.aus1, fw1-2-aus1. NAT: nat-vlan0200-0203/0210.sat4, nat-vlan201.sat6, nat-ks.sat (64.39.0.15). DNS: 26+ hosts including nsmaster1-2.rackspace.com, cachens, dnscore, tinydns entries. DHCP: dhcp.sat.corp (64.39.0.16). Corporate services: kickstart.sat.corp (64.39.0.20), sat4mx05.sat4, sat4fs01.sat4. Also: caravan/windstar/lumina/impulse.sat (named servers), movingvan/warehouse.rackspace.com, rackspaceuniversity.com (cbt). Source: rDNS 64.39.0.0/24.

name: ObjectRocket GCP Hosting Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] ObjectRocket platform hosted on Google Cloud Platform. DNS A record: 35.238.191.165 (GCP us-central1 range). Self-hosted authoritative DNS at dfw3dns1/iad2dns0.objectrocket.com (only Rackspace domain with self-hosted DNS). Registered 2011-12-22 via CSC Corporate Domains, expires 2026-12-22. MX to Google Workspace (ASPMX.L.GOOGLE.com). SPF includes _spf.google.com, mailgun.org, mktomail.com (Marketo), mail.zendesk.com. Source: DNS objectrocket.com A/NS/MX/SPF, WHOIS objectrocket.com. ObjectRocket managed database service hosted on Google Cloud Platform. CIDRs are Google-owned (AS15169/AS396982) and dynamically assigned.

name: AS398699 Rackspace US FedRAMP/Gov
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] ARIN-registered 4-byte ASN. Member of RADB AS-RACKSPACE as-set (authoritative, maintained by MAINT-AS10532, last modified 2023-11-13). Also listed in RIPE AS-RACKSPACE (ORG-RA33-RIPE). Appears as downstream in TPG Networks (AS7545) customer set, suggesting APAC transit path. 4-byte ASN range (398000+) indicates recent ARIN allocation, consistent with dedicated government/compliance ASN. No BGP prefixes currently observed via public looking glasses — may be used for private/government peering or reserved. Rationale: Rackspace holds FedRAMP Moderate authorization; dedicated ASN for government workloads is standard practice for FedRAMP-authorized CSPs to maintain boundary separation. Source: bgp.he.net/irr/as-set/AS-RACKSPACE (RADB), bgp.tools/as-set/RADB::AS-RACKSPACE, bgp.he.net/irr/as-set/AS7545:AS-TPGN-Customers. Zero publicly announced BGP prefixes consistent with dedicated government/FedRAMP boundary ASN. May route via private peering or within customer VRFs not visible to public BGP tables.
cidr: None observed (0 public prefixes; likely private/government peering)

name: AS58982 DataPipe Singapore/APAC (Acquired)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] APNIC-registered ASN. as-name DATAPIPE-SG-AP, descr 'DataPipe', country SG. Org: ORG-DA43-AP (DataPipe), address updated to Rackspace Asia Ltd, Room 5101-5105, 51/F, Hopewell Center, 183 Queens Road East, Hong Kong. Abuse contact abuse@rackspace.com. Phone +1-210-312-4000 (Rackspace HQ). Maintained by MAINT-HK-DATAPIPE. Last modified 2020-07-14. Member of RADB AS-RACKSPACE as-set. Part of DataPipe acquisition (November 2017). APAC counterpart to US DataPipe ASNs (AS14492, AS16805, AS22205, AS22576). Source: bgpview.io/asn/58982 (APNIC WHOIS), bgp.he.net/irr/as-set/AS-RACKSPACE. APNIC-registered counterpart to US/EU DataPipe ASNs. Not listed in PeeringDB DataPipe entry (which only shows AS14492/US-East, AS22205/US-West, AS16805/US-Mid, AS24778/London, AS24043/HK). Suggests this is a supplementary APAC ASN. Source: peeringdb.com/net/230, bgpview.io/asn/58982.

name: AS200069 Mailjet SAS (Divested to Sinch)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RIPE-registered ASN. as-name MAILJET, org ORG-MS158-RIPE (Mailjet SAS), 43 rue de Dunkerque, 75010 Paris, France. Transit from AS16276 (OVH) and AS8218. Created 2013-10-16. Mailgun (Rackspace subsidiary) acquired Mailjet December 2019. Mailgun spun off from Rackspace in 2017. Pathwire (Mailgun parent) acquired by Sinch AB September 2021 for $1.9B. ASN remains in RADB AS-RACKSPACE as-set (last modified 2023-11-13) for transit routing continuity, but entity is no longer Rackspace-owned. Included in KG for historical relationship and because Rackspace backbone still provides transit. Source: bgpview.io/asn/200069, bgp.he.net/irr/as-set/AS-RACKSPACE, sinch.com/news/sinch-acquires-mailgun-and-mailjet, en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mailgun. 110 IPv4, 0 IPv6 prefixes per RIPEstat (2026-02-05 verification). Holder: MAILGUN-US per RIPEstat — confirms Mailgun/Mailjet unified operation under Sinch. Source: stat.ripe.net/resource/AS396479 (note: AS396479 and AS200069 share operational management).

name: AS44009 Rackspace Netherlands (SLEEK-ASN, AMS50)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RIPE-registered ASN. as-name SLEEK-ASN, org ORG-RA33-RIPE (Rackspace Ltd). Status ASSIGNED. AMS50 datacenter, Netherlands. Transit from AS174 (Cogent), AS3549 (Global Crossing/Lumen), AS6939 (Hurricane Electric), AS24867, AS51762. Provides transit to customer ASNs: AS197972, AS50286. Created 2007-11-02, last modified 2024-10-01. Not in RADB AS-RACKSPACE as-set but directly registered to Rackspace RIPE organization. Likely serves Netherlands/Benelux colocation or managed hosting customers. Source: bgpview.io/asn/44009 (RIPE WHOIS). 130 domains across 34 IPs per ipinfo.io. Small but active Netherlands production ASN.

name: Rackspace Cloud API Gateway (identity.api.rackspacecloud.com)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Central identity/authentication API for all Rackspace Cloud services. Endpoint: https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/tokens. Returns service catalog with regional endpoints for all cloud products. Documented in Rackspace API authentication flow. All cloud API calls require token from this endpoint. Single global endpoint (not regionalized). Products served: Cloud Servers (Nova), Cloud Files (Swift), Cloud Block Storage (Cinder), Cloud Databases, Cloud Backup, Cloud Networks (Neutron), Cloud Queues (Marconi), RackConnect v3, Autoscale, Cloud Load Balancers, Cloud DNS, Cloud Monitoring. Regional API pattern: https://{region}.{service}.api.rackspacecloud.com/v{version}/{tenantId} where region ∈ {dfw, iad, ord, lon, hkg, syd}. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-servers/v2/general-api-info/service-access, docs-ospc.rackspace.com/cloud-block-storage/v1/getting-started/authenticate.html, wiki.christophchamp.com/Rackspace_API.
cidr: Service (hosted on Rackspace production ASNs, identity API resolves to regional IPs)

name: RackConnect API Network (api.rackconnect.rackspace.com)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RackConnect v2.0/v3.0 API endpoints. ServiceNet-only (private network, not publicly routable). Regional endpoints: {dfw,hkg,iad,lon,ord,syd}.api.rackconnect.rackspace.com. Authenticates by source IP on ServiceNet — cloud server's private IP determines authorization. Used for hybrid cloud connectivity management between dedicated and cloud infrastructure. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/the-rackconnect-v20-api.

name: Out-of-Band Management Network (IPMI/iDRAC/iLO)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Dedicated OOB management network for server BMC/IPMI/Dell iDRAC/HP iLO access. Evidence: rDNS on IAD corporate block (69.20.0.0/24) shows BMC-pattern hostnames. Standard practice for managed hosting providers with FedRAMP/SOC2/PCI compliance — NIST 800-53 SC-7 requires separation of management and production traffic. Rackspace operates 100,000+ physical servers requiring remote management access independent of production network paths. Typically uses dedicated RFC1918 addressing (172.16.x.x or 10.x.x.x) with jump host/bastion access control. Rationale: Every enterprise-scale DC operator with compliance requirements maintains physically or logically separated OOB management. Source: rDNS evidence from net-052 (IAD block), NIST 800-53 SC-7, Rackspace SOC2/FedRAMP compliance disclosures.
cidr: Private (RFC1918, dedicated OOB VLAN per DC region)

name: DDoS Mitigation / Traffic Scrubbing Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Dedicated DDoS mitigation and traffic scrubbing infrastructure. Evidence: rDNS on DFW corporate block (72.3.128.0/24) shows Arbor Networks and Cisco Guard appliance hostnames — these are purpose-built DDoS mitigation platforms. Rackspace FedRAMP authorization and PCI DSS Level 1 certification require documented DDoS mitigation capabilities. At Rackspace scale (799K+ IPs on DFW alone), inline or divert-and-scrub architecture requires dedicated network segments for clean/dirty traffic separation. Likely deployed at each major IX peering point (DFW, IAD, LON) with BGP flowspec or RTBH (Remote Triggered Black Hole) integration. Source: rDNS evidence from net-051 (DFW block), FedRAMP CA-3/SC-5 control requirements, PCI DSS Req 1.3.
cidr: Various (dedicated mitigation segments at DFW, IAD, LON peering points)

name: Inter-DC Private Transport (DFW-IAD-ORD-LON Dark Fiber/DWDM)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] Private inter-datacenter transport network connecting major Rackspace facilities. Rackspace's AS12200 backbone carries transit between regional ASNs (AS33070 DFW, AS27357 IAD, AS19994 ORD, AS15395 LON), but at this scale private dark fiber or DWDM wavelength services are standard between primary facilities to avoid public internet transit for east-west traffic. The DFW-IAD-ORD triangle represents Rackspace's primary US compute footprint, and data replication/backup between these sites requires dedicated high-bandwidth private paths. RackConnect MPLS VPN backbone (net-039) likely rides this physical infrastructure. Rationale: Any provider with 1.3M+ originated IPs across 3 US DCs and FedRAMP authorization requires private transport — public internet transit for inter-DC traffic would be both a performance and compliance liability.

name: Network Monitoring / NMS Infrastructure (Rackwatch)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Dedicated network monitoring and management station network. Evidence: rDNS on DFW corporate block shows 'rackwatch' hostnames — Rackspace's internal monitoring platform. Additional evidence of MRTG and WhatsUp Gold monitoring tools in rDNS. Rackspace Monitoring (formerly Cloud Monitoring) is a documented public product providing monitoring of cloud and dedicated infrastructure. At enterprise scale, NMS infrastructure requires dedicated network segments to prevent monitoring traffic from competing with production workloads and to ensure monitoring remains functional during outages. NIST 800-53 SI-4 (System Monitoring) and AU-6 (Audit Review) require continuous monitoring capabilities. Source: rDNS evidence from net-051 (DFW block), docs.rackspace.com Cloud Monitoring documentation.
cidr: Private (dedicated monitoring VLANs per DC region)

name: Cloud Networks Tenant Overlay (OpenStack Neutron SDN)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Software-defined overlay network providing tenant isolation for Rackspace Cloud. Rackspace Cloud Networks is based on OpenStack Neutron API (documented: developer.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-networks/v2). Supports up to 10 cloud networks per region, 250 hosts per network. Uses VXLAN or GRE encapsulation for tenant isolation on shared physical infrastructure. ServiceNet (10.x.x.x) provides multi-tenant east-west connectivity; Cloud Networks provides isolated L2 segments. Regional API endpoints: {region}.networks.api.rackspacecloud.com. Regions: DFW, IAD, ORD, LON, HKG, SYD. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-servers/v2/general-api-info/service-access, developer.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-networks/v2.

name: Backup and Replication Network (Cloud Backup, Managed Storage)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Dedicated backup and storage replication network. Evidence: NetworksDB shows 'RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-BACKUP-LON3' and 'RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-STORAGE-LON3' named allocations with dedicated /26 and /29 subnets. Similar patterns exist for SYD2 (RSPC-AU-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-STORAGE-SYD2) and HK (RSPC-HK-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-STORAGE). Rackspace Cloud Backup API has regional endpoints: {region}.backup.api.rackspacecloud.com for DFW, IAD, ORD, HKG, SYD. Backup traffic is isolated from production to prevent bandwidth contention during backup windows. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace (backup/storage named blocks), docs-ospc.rackspace.com/cloud-backup/v1/getting-started/authenticate.html.
cidr: Various (dedicated backup/storage subnets: LON3, SYD2, HK named blocks + ServiceNet overlay)

name: FedRAMP Boundary Network (Government Cloud)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] Dedicated network boundary for Rackspace Government Cloud (FedRAMP Moderate authorization). FedRAMP requires documented system boundary with defined network perimeter controls (NIST 800-53 SC-7, CA-3). AS398699 (net-056, 4-byte ASN with zero public prefixes) is consistent with a dedicated government boundary ASN providing routing isolation. Rackspace Government Cloud operates in dedicated infrastructure at IAD datacenter (primary US government computing region). Boundary must include: dedicated firewalls, IDS/IPS, boundary protection devices, and controlled interface points to non-government networks. FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules required for data in transit across boundary. Source: Rackspace FedRAMP Moderate authorization (Rackspace Private Cloud), NIST 800-53 Rev5 SC-7, AS398699 analysis (net-056).
cidr: Isolated (FedRAMP boundary, separate from commercial cloud)

name: PCI DSS Cardholder Data Environment (CDE) Segments
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] Dedicated network segments for PCI DSS Level 1 compliant cardholder data environment. Rackspace holds PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certification (highest level, processing >6M transactions annually). PCI DSS Req 1.3 requires DMZ between CDE and untrusted networks. Req 1.2.1 requires network segmentation to isolate CDE from non-CDE systems. At managed hosting scale, Rackspace must maintain isolated CDE segments for customers processing payment card data. Segments require dedicated firewalls, restricted access control lists, and continuous network monitoring (Req 10). Network architecture must be documented in network diagrams per Req 1.1.2. Source: Rackspace PCI DSS Level 1 AOC (Attestation of Compliance), PCI DSS v4.0 Requirements 1.2, 1.3, 11.4.
cidr: Isolated (dedicated CDE segments with DMZ, per PCI DSS Req 1.3)

name: Customer VPN / Managed Services Remote Access Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] Dedicated VPN and remote access infrastructure for managed services delivery. Rackspace Managed Hosting services require secure remote access to customer environments for 'Fanatical Support' operations. rDNS evidence from UK managed hosting blocks shows 'RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-HOSTING' and 'RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-INTERNAL' named allocations. Customer VPN concentrators provide site-to-site connectivity between customer premises and Rackspace managed environments. Internal access uses jump hosts/bastion servers with MFA. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace-managed-hosting-ltd (17 named UK internal/managed hosting networks), Rackspace SOC2 Type II control descriptions.
cidr: Various (VPN concentrator IPs within UK managed hosting blocks: 83.138.x.x, 89.234.x.x, 212.100.x.x)

name: AS24043 DataPipe Hong Kong (Acquired, Decommissioned)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] APNIC-registered ASN. as-name DATAPIPE-HK-AP, descr 'DataPipe Hong Kong', country HK. Org: ORG-DA43-AP (DataPipe). Abuse: abuse@rackspace.com. mnt-by: MAINT-HK-DATAPIPE. Last modified 2020-07-14. Member of RADB AS-DATAPIPE as-set. Listed in PeeringDB under DataPipe AS14492 (AS24043 Hong Kong). Transit from AS4637, AS17819, AS10026, AS3491, AS6808, and AS14492 (DataPipe US-East). Imported AS-DATAPIPE from AS14492. NOT VISIBLE in global routing table since May 18, 2024 per bgp.he.net — prefixes likely migrated to AS45187 (Rackspace HKG) or AS58982 (DataPipe SG). Zero peers, zero upstreams, zero downstreams per ipinfo.io. Source: bgp.he.net/AS24043, bgp.tools/as/24043, peeringdb.com/net/14222, ipinfo.io/AS24043.
cidr: None (decommissioned, not visible since May 2024; historically 6 IPv4 + 1 IPv6 prefix)

name: Rackspace ServiceNet (Internal Multi-Tenant Network)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Internal east-west network connecting all cloud infrastructure within each Rackspace region. Uses 10.x.x.x RFC1918 addressing. Documented in Rackspace networking docs: 'ServiceNet is multi-tenant' — carries inter-server traffic within a region. Filtered on source/destination MAC and destination IP to prevent spoofing. NAT does not work via ServiceNet. RackConnect API authenticates by ServiceNet source IP. Available in all regions (DFW, IAD, ORD, LON, HKG, SYD). Rackspace recommends Cloud Networks over ServiceNet for inter-server communication due to multi-tenant nature. Source: docs-ospc.rackspace.com/user-guides/infrastructure/cloud-config/network/cloud-networks-product-concepts/network-cloud-servers, docs.rackspace.com/docs/the-rackconnect-v20-api.

name: Rackspace PublicNet (Cloud Server Public Network)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Public-facing network providing internet connectivity to Rackspace Cloud Servers. Each cloud server receives a public IPv4 address (additional IPs available on request, max 5 per server) and optionally IPv6 from regional ASN pools. Public IPs drawn from regional ASN prefix space (AS33070 DFW, AS27357 IAD, AS19994 ORD, AS15395 LON, AS45187 HKG, AS58683 SYD). Cloud Load Balancers can serve as alternative to multiple public IPs. IPv6 available on Cloud Servers. Source: docs-ospc.rackspace.com/user-guides/infrastructure/cloud-config/network/cloud-networks-product-concepts/network-cloud-servers.
cidr: Various (public IPs from regional ASN pools across all 6 regions)

name: Staging / Pre-Production Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] Dedicated staging and pre-production network environment for Rackspace service deployment. Standard SDLC practice for service providers operating at Rackspace scale. NIST 800-53 CM-2 (Baseline Configuration) and CM-3 (Configuration Change Control) require testing changes before production deployment. Rackspace operates OpenStack-based cloud platform and managed hosting services requiring staging environments for release validation, capacity planning, and integration testing. Staging environments typically mirror production network architecture on a smaller scale. SOC 2 Type II change management controls require documented testing before production changes. Rationale: Any FedRAMP-authorized, PCI Level 1, SOC 2 Type II certified provider maintains staging environments — deploying directly to production would violate multiple compliance frameworks.

name: Rackspace UK Managed Hosting Internal Networks
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated internal network allocations for Rackspace Managed Hosting UK operations. NetworksDB shows 17 IPv4 networks under 'Rackspace Managed Hosting Limited' with RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-INTERNAL naming convention. Key ranges: 89.234.30.128/25 (largest block, 128 IPs), 83.138.x.x series (/26 blocks at .129.192, .141.128, .144.64, .145.80, .146.192, .147.128, .151.128, .151.192), 212.100.225.0/26, 212.100.229.64/26. Also includes RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-HOSTING named allocations. Registered to CW-RACKSPACE-NET (Cable & Wireless heritage). Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace-managed-hosting-ltd.

name: Rackspace APAC Managed Storage Networks (HK/SYD)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated managed storage network allocations for Rackspace APAC operations. NetworksDB shows named allocations: RSPC-HK-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-STORAGE (120.136.36.72/29), RSPC-AU-RACKSPACE-MANAGED-STORAGE-SYD2 (119.9.146.56/29). Also Rackspace.com org shows 52 IPv4 networks under rackspace.com including 180.150.x.x APAC blocks (multiple /24s: 180.150.133.128/25, 180.150.150.0/24, 180.150.151.0/24, 180.150.152.0/24, 180.150.158.0/24, 180.150.159.0/24). Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace.

name: Rackspace CDN Edge Network (Akamai Partnership)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Rackspace CDN powered by Akamai Technologies. Custom map of 200+ edge nodes across six continents: 77 North America, 36 Europe, 73 Asia/Middle East/Oceania, 15 South America. Integrated with Cloud Files — marking containers as public auto-distributes to Akamai CDN. CDN API endpoint: global.cdn.api.rackspacecloud.com. CNAME pattern: *.cdn1.raxcdn.com. Flavor: 'cdn' (Akamai provider). Supports origin-pull, geo-restriction, TTL control, CORS, cookie forwarding, shared SAN certificates. Partnership expanded Oct 2021 to include Elastic Engineering for security services. Akamai operates 325,000 servers in 135+ countries. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/getting-started-with-cloud-files-and-cdn, docs.rackspace.com/docs/features-of-rackspace-cdn, rackspace.com/blog/rackspace-technology-akamai-technologies-elastic-engineering-security.
cidr: External (Akamai edge IP space, not Rackspace-originated; 200+ PoPs globally)

name: Cloud Servers UK Production Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated IP allocations for Rackspace Cloud Servers UK (LON region). NetworksDB shows named allocations RSPC-UK-CLOUD-SERVERS-UK across multiple blocks: 162.13.144.0/20 (4,096 IPs, largest block), 134.213.24.0/21 (2,048 IPs), plus smaller allocations in 83.138.x.x, 78.136.x.x, 94.236.x.x, 212.64.x.x, 31.222.x.x, 5.79.x.x ranges. Additional RSPC-UK-CLOUD-SERVERS-UK-105-109 named blocks in 164.177.x.x, 162.13.x.x. All under AS15395 (Rackspace LON) address space. Organization: 'Cloud Servers UK' under Rackspace Ltd. Source: networksdb.io/network/rspc-uk-cloud-servers-uk.

name: Rackspace UK Backup Network (LON3)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated backup infrastructure network at LON3 facility. NetworksDB shows named allocations RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE-BACKUP-LON3: 134.213.86.0/26 (64 IPs, primary block), 134.213.143.160/29 (8 IPs). Separate from managed storage blocks. Purpose-built for backup operations at London LON3 datacenter. Under AS15395 address space. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace.

name: Rackspace UK Managed Storage Network (LON3)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated managed storage network at LON3 facility. NetworksDB shows named allocations RSPC-UK-RACKSPACE---MANAGED-STORAGE---LON3: 94.236.1.208/29 (8 IPs) + 212.64.142.72/29 (8 IPs). Under AS15395 (Rackspace LON) address space. Complements backup infrastructure at same facility. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace.

name: Rackspace Enterprise Hybrid Hosting Network (US)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated IP allocations for Enterprise Hybrid Hosting customers in US regions. NetworksDB shows multiple RACKS-8-* named blocks with 'Enterprise Hybrid Hosting' description. Examples: 204.232.150.192/29, 162.209.38.104/29, 72.32.37.96/29, 198.61.157.124/30, 108.166.6.60/30, 162.209.38.140/30. These are small (/29-/30) customer-facing allocations from ARIN RACKS-8 (Rackspace Hosting) org. Distributed across DFW/IAD/ORD production ASNs. UUID-format naming (RACKS-8-{UUID}) indicates automated provisioning system. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace.

name: Rackspace APAC Storage Domain Global Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Dedicated 'Storage Domain - Global' network allocations in APAC region. NetworksDB shows named allocations RSPC-AU-RACKSPACE-STORAGE-DOMAIN-GLOBAL: 119.9.150.48/30 (4 IPs) + 119.9.150.172/30 (4 IPs). Within AS58683 (SYD/APAC) address space (119.9.0.0/18). Designated as 'Global' suggesting cross-region storage replication endpoint. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace.

name: Rackspace Cloud Load Balancers Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Cloud Load Balancers service providing L4/L7 load balancing across cloud servers. Regional API endpoints: {region}.loadbalancers.api.rackspacecloud.com for DFW, IAD, ORD, LON, HKG, SYD. VIPs (Virtual IPs) allocated from regional ASN public address pools. Supports HTTP, HTTPS, TCP protocols with SSL termination, health monitoring, connection throttling, content caching, access lists. Part of Rackspace Cloud service catalog returned by identity.api authentication. Source: docs.rackspace.com Cloud Load Balancers documentation, service catalog endpoint data.
cidr: Service (VIPs from regional ASN pools across all 6 regions)

name: Rackspace Cloud Monitoring Poller Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Rackspace Cloud Monitoring service uses distributed poller infrastructure to check customer endpoints from multiple locations worldwide. API endpoint: monitoring.api.rackspacecloud.com (global, not regionalized). Monitoring zones correspond to Rackspace DC regions plus additional international locations for geographic diversity. Pollers generate outbound HTTP, TCP, ICMP checks from Rackspace IP space. Complements internal NMS (net-065) — Cloud Monitoring is customer-facing while Rackwatch is internal. Source: docs.rackspace.com Cloud Monitoring API documentation.
cidr: Service (poller IPs distributed across Rackspace production ASNs + global monitoring zones)

name: Rackspace Cloud Files Storage Network (Object Storage)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] OpenStack Swift-based object storage service. Regional API endpoints: {region}.files.api.rackspacecloud.com and storage101.{region}N.clouddrive.com (internal ServiceNet access). CDN-integrated via Akamai (net-077). Regions: DFW, IAD, ORD, LON, HKG, SYD. Containers publish to CDN via single API call. Supports dynamic/static large objects, CDN-enabled containers. Internal (ServiceNet) access: snet-storage101.{region}N.clouddrive.com — zero-cost intra-region transfer. Source: docs.rackspace.com/docs/getting-started-with-cloud-files-and-cdn, docs.cyberduck.io/protocols/openstack/cloudfiles.
cidr: Service (storage101.{region}N.clouddrive.com, distributed across regional ASNs + ServiceNet)

name: Rackspace Cloud Databases Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Managed database service providing MySQL/MariaDB/Percona instances. Regional API endpoints: {region}.databases.api.rackspacecloud.com/v1.0/{tenantId} for DFW, IAD, ORD, HKG, SYD. Database instances accessible via ServiceNet or public IP. Part of Rackspace Cloud service catalog. Source: docs-ospc.rackspace.com/cloud-block-storage/v1/getting-started/authenticate.html (service catalog showing all database endpoints).
cidr: Service (database instances accessible via ServiceNet 10.x.x.x + optional public IPs from regional ASNs)

name: Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Network (Cinder)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] OpenStack Cinder-based block storage service providing SSD and SATA volumes attachable to Cloud Servers. Regional API endpoints: {region}.blockstorage.api.rackspacecloud.com/v1/{tenantId} for DFW, IAD, ORD, HKG, SYD. Block storage traffic uses dedicated storage network (iSCSI/NFS backend) within each region, separate from PublicNet and ServiceNet. Part of Rackspace Cloud service catalog. Source: docs-ospc.rackspace.com/cloud-block-storage/v1/getting-started/authenticate.html.
cidr: Service (iSCSI/NFS backend on dedicated storage VLANs, API via regional ASNs)

name: Rackspace Autoscale API Network
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Rackspace Autoscale service for automatic scaling of Cloud Servers based on policies and schedules. Regional API endpoints: {region}.autoscale.api.rackspacecloud.com/v1.0/{tenantId} for DFW, IAD, ORD, HKG, SYD. Orchestrates Cloud Servers and Cloud Load Balancers for horizontal scaling. Part of Rackspace Cloud service catalog. Source: docs-ospc.rackspace.com/autoscale/v1/developer-guide/getting-started/authenticate.html.
cidr: Service (API via regional ASNs, orchestrates existing cloud infrastructure)

name: Rackspace Cloud Queues Network (Marconi)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] OpenStack Marconi-based message queuing service supporting producer-consumer and publish-subscriber patterns. Regional API endpoints available via service catalog. Provides unlimited queues and messages for distributed application messaging. Part of Rackspace Cloud service catalog. Source: docs.rackspace.com Cloud Queues documentation, developer.rackspace.com/docs/cloud-queues/v1.

name: Rackspace UK Customer Managed Hosting Allocations
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] Customer-facing IP allocations within Rackspace UK managed hosting infrastructure. NetworksDB shows RSPC-UK-{CUSTOMER} naming pattern for managed hosting customers including major enterprises. Rackspace allocates small /29-/31 blocks from its RIPE-registered address space (83.138.x.x, 89.234.x.x, 94.236.x.x, 162.13.x.x, 164.177.x.x, 212.64.x.x) to individual managed hosting customers. These represent Rackspace infrastructure used by customers, not customer-owned IP space. Pattern demonstrates Rackspace managed hosting business model in UK market. Source: networksdb.io/ip-addresses-of/rackspace-managed-hosting-ltd, multiple RSPC-UK-{customer} named allocations.

name: AS24867 Adapt Services Limited UK (Acquired via DataPipe)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T1] RIPE-registered ASN. as-name Adapt-AS, org ORG-MISL1-RIPE (Adapt Services Limited). Registered UK, 2002-09-19. 84,960 IPv4 addresses across 72 prefixes, 0 IPv6. Rank #2,189 of 78,892 ASNs globally by IPv4 space. Receives transit from AS24778 (Datapipe Europe). Additional transit: AS3356 (Level3/Lumen), AS2914 (NTT), AS174 (Cogent). Announces AS-ADAPT-CUST to all upstreams. 748 domains across 284 IPs. Member of RADB AS-ADAPT sub-set within AS-RACKSPACE. Primary prefix: 83.217.96.0/19 (registered to uk.rackspace in RIPE). Acquisition chain: Adapt → DataPipe (pre-2017) → Rackspace (Nov 2017). Confirmed on rackspace.com/datapipe acquisition page. Source: bgp.he.net/AS24867, bigdatacloud.com/asn-lookup/AS24867, bgp.tools/prefix/83.217.96.0/19, ipinfo.io/AS24867.

name: GoGrid Cloud Infrastructure (Acquired via DataPipe, Legacy)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] GoGrid cloud IaaS platform, acquired by DataPipe January 20, 2015, then by Rackspace November 2017. GoGrid operated DCs in San Francisco and Amsterdam. 15,000+ customers, 600,000+ VMs deployed. Founded as ServePath, rebranded GoGrid 2008. Focus shifted to Big Data infrastructure 2013 (Cloudera/Hadoop). RADB AS-GOGRID sub-set exists within AS-RACKSPACE but specific ASN number not publicly resolved — GoGrid likely operated under DataPipe ASNs (AS14492 US, AS24778 Europe) rather than its own dedicated ASN. GoGrid login portal (my.gogrid.com) still redirects to DataPipe. Source: rackspace.com/datapipe, businesswire.com GoGrid acquisition announcement, datacenterknowledge.com/cloud/datapipe-buys-gogrid.
cidr: Legacy (GoGrid infrastructure absorbed into DataPipe/Rackspace ASN pools)

name: Layered Technologies Infrastructure (Acquired via DataPipe, Legacy)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T2] Layered Technologies PCI/HIPAA/FISMA-compliant hosting provider, based in Plano, Texas. Acquired by DataPipe August 2014, then by Rackspace November 2017. Accel-KKR backed ($20M equity 2010). Acquired GSI Hosting (77,000 sqft DC in Kansas City, MO, Nov 2010) and New World Apps (federal cloud, Virginia). RADB AS-LAYERED sub-set exists within AS-RACKSPACE. Specific ASN not publicly resolved — note AS210893 'Layered Technologies Limited' exists in RIPE but is a UK entity registered 2022, likely unrelated to the original Texas company. Original Layered Tech infrastructure absorbed into DataPipe/Rackspace ASN pools. Source: rackspace.com/datapipe, accel-kkr.com/layered-technologies-acquires-gsi-hosting, datacenterknowledge.com/investing/layered-tech-gets-20m.
cidr: Legacy (Layered Tech infrastructure absorbed into DataPipe/Rackspace ASN pools)

name: FastServers / HostCentric Infrastructure (Acquired, Legacy)
description: [CONFIDENCE: T3] RADB AS-FASTSERVERS sub-set exists within AS-RACKSPACE. HostCentric (later FastServers) was a Rackspace hosting acquisition. Specific acquisition date and ASN details not resolved from public sources. Infrastructure presumed absorbed into Rackspace production ASNs. Maintained in AS-RACKSPACE routing policy for legacy prefix routing continuity. Rationale: AS-FASTSERVERS presence in AS-RACKSPACE indicates Rackspace continues to announce prefixes originally allocated to this entity.
cidr: Legacy (infrastructure absorbed into Rackspace ASN pools)
